text: [Music]
[Music]
hello i'm gauri a cloud support engineer
here at the aws office in dallas
sometimes customers ask me why they
can't view their billing console even
though their user or role has the
appropriate permissions
today i'm going to show you how you can
allow an aws identity and access
management user to view your account's
billing information let's get started
sign in to the aws management console
with your root account credentials these
are the email address and password that
were used to create your aws account
only the root user can enable im access
to billing it's a best practice that the
root user is never used unless required
as is the case here on the top
navigation bar choose your username and
in the drop down list choose my account
scroll down to imuser and role access to
billing information
choose edit check the activate im access
box
choose update now that we've activated
im access to billing account
administrators can control who can
access the account's billing information
with the impermissions policies
log out of your root account by choosing
your username on the navigation bar and
choose sign out in the drop-down list
next sign in to the aws management
console with your im user credentials
on the top navigation bar enter iam
choose users on the left side of the
screen
navigate to your user in this case the
user is named casey video
choose add permissions
choose attach existing policies directly
enter billing and then check the box
next to the amazon manage policy named
billing
choose next review
choose add permissions
now that we've given billing permissions
to our user on the top navigation bar
enter billing your imuser now has access
to the billing console
now you know how to give your im users
access to your account's billing
information
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
